channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: U.N. Climate Adaptation Report Shows Declining Money for Climate Disasters
item.description: In 2021, rich countries vowed to spend more to help poor countries adapt to warming. That goal is unlikely to be met, a new report finds.

item.title: Whole Foods, MAHA and the Battle Over Healthy Eating in America
item.description: As diet and wellness become increasingly politicized, one of the most recognizable grocery brands navigates the debate.

item.title: UPS CFO on Amazon pullback and driving a growth strategy
item.description: Brian Dykes explains why UPS is prioritizing profitability over volume, and how refocusing its network is delivering results.

item.title: AI doesn’t fail on tech—it fails on leadership
item.description: Moving beyond the AI hype cycle toward the autonomous enterprise starts with intentional leadership.

item.title: In Utah, Trump’s Vision for Homelessness Begins to Take Shape
item.description: State officials promise large-scale involuntary addiction and mental health treatment at Salt Lake City’s edge. Critics see “a prison, or a warehouse....

item.title: Chanel’s CEO went to Microsoft HQ and asked ChatGPT to show her a picture of her company’s leadership. They were all men in suits
item.description: Leena Nair said more than 75% of her company’s employees are female.

item.title: HKEX CEO Bonnie Chan says global stock exchanges have to work together to stay relevant in a crypto age
item.description: "We're entering a stage where exchanges are not really competing with one another, but working together," HKEX CEO Bonnie Chan said.

item.title: How the Opium War Still Shapes Xi Jinping’s Trade Clash With Trump
item.description: China’s leader draws on lessons from Lin Zexu, a Qing official whose defiance of Britain led to China’s humiliating defeat but made him a national her...

item.title: Obamacare Prices Become Public, Highlighting Big Increases
item.description: The government website now shows consumers how much their health insurance costs will increase next year, as Congress remains at an impasse over the p...

item.title: Nvidia is officially the world’s first $5 trillion company. CEO Jensen Huang says it’s on track for ‘half a trillion dollars’ in revenue
item.description: Nvidia reached the $5 trillion threshold just three months after becoming the first company to hit $4 trillion.

item.title: Live Updates: Hurricane Melissa Batters Cuba as Jamaica Assesses Damage
item.description: The storm brought flooding, landslides and storm surge to both islands. In Jamaica, blocked roads and communications outages were hampering efforts to...

item.title: Money to Help Nations Cope With Climate Disasters Is Declining, U.N. Says
item.description: In 2021, rich countries vowed to spend more to help poor countries adapt to warming. That goal is unlikely to be met, a new report finds.

item.title: Mercedes Reports a Drop in Profit but Maintains Its Forecast
item.description: The German carmaker held its outlook steady and said it would buy back more than $2 billion in shares, as sales of its high-end models improved.

item.title: Feted as a Peacemaker in South Korea, Trump Finds Purpose for Overtures to Kim Jong-un
item.description: President Trump lamented not being able to speak with Mr. Kim, the North Korean leader, but vowed to end the decades of hostilities between the two Ko...

item.title: As China and U.S. Fight Over Energy, Korea Is Stuck in the Middle
item.description: It needs the United States for defense and has spent billions building factories in America. But a Trump trade deal this week with China could erase a...
